comment: Water Observed schema adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.Environment/master/WaterObserved/schema.json
description: Water observation data model is intended to represent the parameters of flow, level and volume of water observed, as well as the swell information, over a fixed or variable area. This observation also includes the masses of floating objects on this area. The data collected is provided by Sensors, Cameras,Water stations positioned at specific or sensitive locations for rivers, streams, torrent, lakes, seas, etc.

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateObserved
contents.comment: Date and time of this observation represented by an ISO8601 UTC format.

contents.name: dateObservedFrom
contents.comment: Observation period : Start date and time in an ISO8601 UTC format.

contents.name: dateObservedTo
contents.comment: Observation period : End date and time in an ISO8601 UTC format.

contents.name: description
contents.comment: A description of this item

contents.name: flow
contents.comment: Water Flow observed. The unit code (text) of measurement given using the UN/CEFACAT

contents.name: height
contents.comment: Water height - Level reach on alert coasts.

contents.name: measuredArea
contents.comment: Reference of the surface measured. The unit code (text) of measurement given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes) (max. 3 characters). For instance, MTK represents M².

contents.name: name
contents.comment: The name of this item.

contents.name: objectArea
contents.comment: Percentage occupied by floating object in the area. The unit code (text) of measurement given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes) (max. 3 characters). For instance, P1 represents Percentage.

contents.name: objectHeightAverage
contents.comment: Average height raised. The unit code (text) of measurement given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes) (max. 3 characters). For instance, MTR represents Meter.

contents.name: objectHeightMax
contents.comment: Maximum height raised. The unit code (text) of measurement given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes) (max. 3 characters). For instance, MTR represents Meter.

contents.name: objectVolume
contents.comment: Estimated volume raised. The unit code (text) of measurement given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes) (max. 3 characters). For instance, MTQ represents Cubic Meters

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.

contents.name: swellDirection
contents.comment: Swells Direction observed.

contents.name: swellHeight
contents.comment: Swell height observed.

contents.name: swellPeriod
contents.comment: Swells period observed.

contents.name: waveLength
contents.comment: Wave Length observed.

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)

contents.name: address
contents.comment: The mailing address
